articles.title: Kim Jong Il Commands Flying Exercises of KPA Air Force Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Commands Flying Exercises of KPA Air Force Unit

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, commanded the flying exercises of the KPA Air Force Unit 378 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Commands Flying Exercises of KPA Air Force Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Commands Flying Exercises of KPA Air Force Unit

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, commanded the flying exercises of KPA Air Force Unit 378 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.
					
					He was greeted on the spot by KPA General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the Air Force, and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					After receiving a salute, he learned about the unit's performance of guard duty and mounted a commanding post to guide the exercises of pilots.
					
					He carefully watched valiant and courageous pilots conducting a drill in the atmosphere of real war while making flights. They are very good at training and bold in flight mobility, he said with high appreciation, congratulating them on their successful training.
					
					Any enemies dare not pounce upon Songun Korea, and it is further displaying its dignity as the unbreakable socialist fortress and our revolutionary cause is always emerging victorious as such proud pilots defend the territorial air of the country, he said.
					
					He met with the pilots involved in the training and repeatedly congratulated them on their successful training, showing benevolent solicitude for them.
					
					Then, he went round a bedroom, a mess hall and lecture rooms for the pilots of a sub-unit of the unit to take meticulous care of their life as their real parents would do.
					
					He enjoyed a performance given by an art group of the pilots of the unit.
					
					He had a photo session with servicepersons of the unit.
					
					Accompanying him were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and chief of the KPA General Staff, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Kyong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., WPK, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong and Hyon Chol Hae and staff members of the KPA Supreme Command.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Rejects S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Confrontation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Rejects S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Confrontation

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' "policy toward the north" can never be tolerated as it hinders the national peace and reunification and drives the situation of the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Saturday. 
					
					The war provocative moves of the bellicose forces in south Korea are an inevitable result of the "policy toward the north" persistently pursued by its authorities, the article points out, saying:
					
					The watchword "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" raised by south Korean conservative group is aimed at anti-national "unification under the liberal democratic system", and this is sure to lead to confrontation and war moves.
					
					Its confrontation policy is a treacherous policy obstructive to the independent reunification of the Korean nation and a war policy detrimental to the desire of the Koreans and the trend of the times.
					
					If antagonism and distrust are fostered and confrontation escalated between the north and the south of Korea, it will be eternally impossible to achieve its national reunification. 
					
					The ruling forces of south Korea have returned dangerous war moves for the DPRK's efforts to improve the north-south relations and open the door to peace and reunification.
					
					While calling for "peace", they stage mad-cap saber-rattling to provoke a war against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					The people from all walks of life in south Korea are strongly urging the conservative authorities to make a switchover in the policy of confrontation and come out for dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south.
					
					However, the south Korean ruling forces are getting hell-bent on the anti-DPRK provocation and war moves, persistently refusing to change their confrontation policy. This is the last-ditch effort of those doomed to death.
					
					The Korean nation will decisively punish the group of traitors who lay a stumbling block to peace and reunification, going against the trend of the times.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Stresses Need to Make No Concession to Imperialists
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Stresses Need to Make No Concession to Imperialists

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Victory is in store for the progressive people who carry on the struggle without making any concession to the imperialists, stresses Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article.
					
					Noting that various countries' sovereignty has been ruthlessly violated and innocent peaceable inhabitants killed due to the imperialists' wars of aggression, the article says: 
					
					The U.S. warmongers are steadily expanding the theatre of aggression by way of provoking wars on one excuse or another.
					
					The U.S. zealously seeks to reproduce the Iraqi incident with a report of IAEA recently announced to incriminate Iran's nuclear program.
					
					Imperialism does not hesitate to inflict scourge of nuclear war upon humankind.
					
					The facts go to prove that the imperialists remain unchanged in their aggressive nature and that they do never make a present of peace to the people.
					
					Peace should be won through a struggle, and it is important to fight against the aggressors uncompromisingly without making any concession.
					
					Imperialism regards aggression, plunder and war as way of its existence. Any people can not evade a war as long as imperialism exists.
					
					"Reconciliation", "cooperation" and "partnership" on the lip-service of the imperialists do not mean that there is change in imperialism's nature as an aggressor. They are no more than changed way of the imperialists' aggression and domination. 
					
					Nothing is more foolish than to make concession to the imperialists, thinking that their nature has changed through generations and centuries. One-step concession will result in ten- or a hundred-step concessions and, finally, invite grave consequences of ruining a country and nation and meeting the fate of a colonial slavery.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Shakamoto's Assertion upon DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Sakamoto's Rhetoric about DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Sakamoto, member of the House of Representatives of Japan, referring to the Asian regional preliminaries for the 2014 FIFA World Cup held in Pyongyang on November 15, let loose remarks out of common sense.
					
					At the "special committee of abduction issue" of the House of Representatives on November 28, he, turning to Japan's defeat by the DPRK, said that "if Japanese team had defeated the DPRK team 2:0 or 3:0, the Japanese footballers might have been abducted". 
					
					What do his remarks signify?
					
					What he said are too childish to be uttered by a politician holding an official post.
					
					Japan's team had the game with the DPRK team in 22 years after the Asian regional preliminaries for the FIFA World Cup in Italy in 1989. Complicated problems cropped up even before the match at that time because of the frozen relations between the two countries.
					
					The DPRK fairly handled problems from the viewpoint of high game morality and on the universal principle of international relations.
					
					Sakamoto's assertions indicate his distorted way of thinking driven by guilty conscience.
					
					Japan is obliged to feel the guilty conscience as it inflicted huge misfortunes and pain on the Korean people.
					
					He busied himself, currying favor with ultra-right conservative elements obsessed with confrontation with DPRK. But his remarks only became a laughing stock of the world people.
					
					The rhetoric of "abduction" touted by the Japanese politicians is nothing but cliche. 
					
					It is high time that Japan stopped the old and trite rhetoric about "abduction" with which the international community has been fed up.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Past Crimes: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Past Crimes: KCNA Commentary

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Japan attempted to adopt the anti-DPRK "resolution on human rights" while talking about the "abduction issue" at the Third Committee of the 66th UN General Assembly.
					
					The Japanese ambassador to the UN in a speech before voting said that the "potential abduction by the DPRK" couldn't be ruled out as yet and it still remains a pending issue in a bid to build up the public opinion over the human rights issue.
					
					It is ridiculous for the hideous human rights abuser Japan to style itself the initiator of the resolution, talking rhetoric about other country's human rights performance.
					
					This racket kicked up by Japan does not deserve even a passing note as it was another stereotyped and politically-motivated smear campaign staged by the hostile forces to the DPRK including Japan. 
					
					No country is so clamorous about the human rights and humanitarianism on the earth as Japan. 
					
					Outwardly Japan seems to have a pretty deep interest in human rights.
					
					But does Japan really have the right to talk about it?
					
					As far as the human rights issue is concerned, Japan has no qualification to talk about it.
					
					It is because of its wrong attitude towards past atrocities perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists against the Koreans, a harsh violation of human rights unprecedented in history.
					
					Japan has been recorded in history as an infamous war criminal state as it committed horrible atrocities against Koreans during its occupation of Korea.
					
					It massacred more than one million people, kidnapped or forcibly took away 8.4 million and forced 200 000 women into the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army during its military occupation of Korea that has lasted for nearly half a century.
					
					Far from making an honest apology and reparation for its crimes, Japan has sought to push its hideous inhuman crimes under the carpet for the past more than 60 years since the war.
					
					This is the very reason why Japan is more intent on kicking up the anti-DPRK maneuvers than any other country while talking about humanity and human rights in the international arena.
					
					The "abduction issue" had already seen a solution as declared by the DPRK more than once.
					
					Japan is intentionally highlighting the "abduction issue" and internationalizing it while trying to give impression that it remains an outstanding issue. This is aimed to abuse this issue for serving its political and strategic purposes.
					
					Japan had better make reparation for its past crimes before talking about human rights of other country.

articles.title: Judges Protest GNP's Passage of FTA in S. Korea
articles.content:
Judges Protest GNP's Passage of FTA in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Judges in south Korea turned out in a group protest against the "Grand National Party" which railroaded the "motion calling for ratification of the Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S., according to CBS of south Korea.
					
					A senior judge of the Inchon District Court posted on its Internet homepage on Dec. 1 an article condemning the FTA as an unequal agreement violating judicial sovereignty.
					
					In case of a trade conflict with the U.S., south Korea may be deprived of its jurisdiction, the article said, stressing the need for the judicial authority to perform its part.
					
					He said he would request the chief justice of the Supreme Court to set up a body of experts for renegotiations on the FTA.
					
					More than one hundred judges expressed support for his stand in the first day when the article was posted.
					
					The influence of their massive protest is expanding, the broadcasting service reported.

articles.title: Korean People's Historic Advance Is Based on Juche Idea: Peruvian Personage
articles.content:
Korean People's Historic Advance Is Based on Juche Idea: Peruvian Personage

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, issued a statement on Nov. 24 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					The historic advance of the Korean people to build a socialist power is based on the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung, the statement said.
					
					It noted that the Juche idea enabled the Korean people to display indomitable heroism in the efforts to bolster up the national defense capability, defend socialism and overcome all sorts of natural disasters.
					
					The economy is developing in DPRK as it is thoroughly applying the requirements of this idea, it noted, adding the DPRK will emerge an economic power in the near future.

articles.title: Japanese Meet to Express Support for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Japanese Meet to Express Support for Korea's Reunification

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The 29th national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification was held in Fukushima Prefecture, Japan, on Nov. 26.
					
					Attending it were Chairman Fumihiro Himori and members of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, members of the executive committee of the national meeting and representatives of organizations for solidarity with the DPRK from across Japan.
					
					Present on invitation were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of Chongryon.
					
					At the meeting personages of different circles made speeches before a congratulatory message from the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries was read out.
					
					Hirogazu Kitagawa, representative member of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, made a report.
					
					A lecture on the subject of "Path to denuclearization and peace in Northeast Asia" was given.
					
					Then the meeting adopted a written request, which urged the Japanese government to stop the discriminative and national chauvinist encroachment upon the human rights of Korean residents, immediately lift the sanctions against the DPRK and opt for the talks for normalizing diplomatic relations based on the settlement of the past and the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.

articles.title: Cambodia Will Significantly Commemorate Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth: PM
articles.content:
Cambodia Will Significantly Commemorate Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth: PM

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The Cambodian people will join the Korean people in significantly commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, said Prime Minister of Cambodia Hun Sen on Nov. 28 when meeting outgoing DPRK Ambassador to his country Ri In Sok.
					
					The prime minister said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries are traditional ones provided by Great King Norodom Sihanouk and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					These relations are now steadily developing in the interests of the peoples of the two countries, he added.

articles.title: Report of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by British Organizations
articles.content:
Report of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by British Organizations

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a joint statement on Nov. 25 in support of the report of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army.
					
					The statement said:
					
					We fully support the stand of the DPRK revolutionary armed forces to defend the sovereignty and independence of the country, the stand clarified in the report of the KPA Supreme Command.
					
					The KPA has defended the socialist system centered on the popular masses and the peace of Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					Last year's Yonphyong Island incident occurred due to the reckless moves of the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					Entirely just was the action taken by the KPA to cope with them.
					
					The south Korean puppet forces staged again the anti-DPRK war exercises, far from drawing a due lesson.
					
					The report of the Supreme Command of the KPA declared that it would blow out the stronghold of the group of traitors. This is the revolutionary stand reflecting the will of the army and people of the DPRK to reliably defend the sovereignty of the country and socialism under the banner of the Songun idea.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea, Japan Are to Blame for Danger of War in Korean Peninsula: Japanese
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea, Japan Are to Blame for Danger of War in Korean Peninsula: Japanese

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea will resolutely stand against south Korea-U.S. and U.S.-Japan military exercises centering on the U.S. forces.
					
					Hirogazu Kitagawa, representative member of the committee, declared this stand, making a report at the 29th national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification.
					
					The blame for last year's Choenan warship sinking case and Yonphyong Island shelling case was on south Korea which staged the provocative military exercises in the West Sea of Korea, he said.
					
					The very one bringing the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula is the U.S., south Korea and Japan that are ceaselessly staging joint military exercises, he stated.

articles.title: Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued by Koreans in China

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released the November issue of its magazine "Paektu-Halla".
					
					The magazine carried a photo of leader Kim Jong Il and the news that he received Li Keqiang, vice-premier of the State Council of China.
					
					Edited in it were account of events held by the General Association and its affiliated organizations to celebrate the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					It carried articles titled "General and CNC (3)" and "Great history of loyalty going on in the Mansudae area with the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung approaching (1)".
					
					Given in the magazine was the news that a wreath in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet and wreaths from the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Ministry of People's Security, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other institutions of the DPRK were laid before the Friendship Tower on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front.
					
					The Yanbian Regional Association under the General Association and its branches and the Yanbian Regional Committee of the Federation of Korean Youths in China held events to mark the 4th anniversary of the October 4 declaration, the magazine reported.
					
					Carried in it were the statements issued by spokesmen for the National Peace Committee of Korea and the Youth and Student Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration and "Let us give due punishment to the treacherous conservative group", a statement of the General Association of Koreans in China.
					
					The magazine dealt with the actions the people of south Korea staged to condemn the "government" for having railroaded the "motion calling for ratification of Free Trade Agreement".

articles.title: Russia to Take Steps to Cope with U.S. MD System in Europe
articles.content:
Russia to Take Steps to Cope with U.S. MD System in Europe

					Moscow, December 2 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Rogozin, Russian permanent representative to NATO, in a recent interview with a TV referred to Russia's steps to cope with the U.S. scheme to deploy the missile defense system in Europe.
					
					The means to cope with the U.S. MD system in Europe has already been included in the state plan for military equipment up to 2020 which was ratified to develop the national defense industry, he said.

articles.title: Cuba to Take Steps for Developing Oil Industry
articles.content:
Cuba to Take Steps for Developing Oil Industry

					Havana, December 2 (KCNA) -- Cuba is paying efforts to developing the oil industry.
					
					It is planning to expand the oil refineries in Cienfuegos and Santiago de Cuba provinces and build a new refinery in Matanzas Province. And two oil chemical factories will be built in Cienfuegos Province with big government investment.

articles.title: Iran Rejects Western Threat: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
Iran Rejects Western Threat: FM Spokesman

					Tehran, December 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Iranian Foreign Ministry in an interview with a news agency on Nov. 30 resolutely rejected the Western threat of sanctions against his country.
					
					Most of the Western countries have insignificant economic relations with Iran and have no financial ties with it, he said, adding that the sanctions touted by them are part of the psychological warfare.
					
					The Iranian people are firmly taking the road chosen by themselves in face of the U.S. and Western sanctions of past decades, he said.

articles.title: Indonesia Commences Reforestation Campaign Program
articles.content:
Indonesia Commences Reforestation Campaign Program

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Indonesia has set ambitious reforestation program by commencing a campaign to plant one billion trees per year.
					
					In an event President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono called upon all the people to turn out in the reforestation, wealth of the country.

articles.title: India's GDP to Grow 7.3 Pct in Current Fiscal Year: Finance Minister
articles.content:
India's GDP to Grow 7.3 Pct in Current Fiscal Year: Finance Minister

					New Delhi, December 2 (KCNA) -- India's economy is predicted to expand 7.3 percent in the current fiscal year ending on March 31, 2012, according to India's Finance Minister Pranab Mukherjee on Wednesday.

articles.title: Anti-NATO Demonstration Held in Pakistan
articles.content:
Anti-NATO Demonstration Held in Pakistan

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- 700 Pakistanis staged a demonstration in Karachi on Nov. 27 in protest against the NATO forces' indiscriminate air raids which killed Pakistani soldiers.
					
					The demonstrators gathered in front of the U.S. consulate general and strongly protested the recent air raids, chanting anti-U.S. slogans.

articles.title: Nicaragua Censures U.S. Interference
articles.content:
Nicaragua Censures U.S. Interference

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The Nicaraguan ambassador to the Organization of American States recently denounced the U.S. for its interference aimed to create instability in his country.
					
					The U.S. schemed to instigate the opposition camp to nullify the returns of the election in case the Sandinist National Liberation Front wins the election, he said, adding such interference can never be pardoned.

articles.title: Brazil to Apply Additional Fines on Chevron for Oil Spill
articles.content:
Brazil to Apply Additional Fines on Chevron for Oil Spill

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Brazil's environment protection agency Ibama said Tuesday that U.S. oil giant Chevron may be fined an additional 60 million reais (32.6 million U.S. dollars) for the spill off the country's southeastern coast, said Ibama President Curt Trennpohl.
					
					The eventual fines would be related to the environmental damage caused by the spill and to the company not enforcing its emergency plan after the accident.

articles.title: Cooperation among S. American Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among S. American Countries

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Colombia and Venezuela concluded an agreement on expanding bilateral trade on Nov. 28.
					
					Earlier on Nov. 25 member nations of the Union of South American Nations agreed to develop trade and strengthen financial system among countries.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Philippines
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Philippines

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6 on the Richter Scale hit an island of the Philippines on Nov. 30.

articles.title: Economic Stagnation in Japan
articles.content:
Economic Stagnation in Japan

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- New housing starts in Japan fell 5.8 percent in October from a year earlier, marking the second straight year-on-year decline, the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism said in a report on Wednesday.
					
					Meanwhile, Japan's supermarket sales in October edged down 0.9 percent from a year earlier on a same-store basis, declining for the third consecutive month due to sluggish food sales, an industry body said Tuesday.
					
					This is attributable to the falling of buying caused by economic stagnation.

articles.title: Eurozone Unemployment Rate Hits Record 10.3 pct in October
articles.content:
Eurozone Unemployment Rate Hits Record 10.3 pct in October

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) --  Eurostat estimated that 23.554 million men and women in the EU, of whom 16.294 million were in the eurozone, were unemployed in October
					
					Compared with September, the number of persons unemployed rose by 130,000 in the EU and by 126,000 in the eurozone.

articles.title: Economic Crime in New Zealand
articles.content:
Economic Crime in New Zealand

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Almost half of organizations in New Zealand have been victims of economic crime in the last year, according to a survey released on Nov. 30.
					
					The survey showed 49.5 percent of the 93 New Zealand respondents suffered some sort of economic crime in the last 12 months.

articles.title: UNEP Criticizes Developed Countries for Stance at Climate Talks
articles.content:
UNEP Criticizes Developed Countries for Stance at Climate Talks

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The United Nations Environmental Program (UNEP) on Tuesday criticized developed countries for their stance at the UN climate change talks in Durban, South Africa.
					
					A newspaper in South Africa reported that UNEP said in a newsletter distributed at the talks that the developed countries are "stuck on weaker, conditional pledges."
					
					UNEP also said that the greenhouse gas emissions targets set by developed countries are "riddled with loopholes."

articles.title: Malaysia Slams Israel's Illegal Policies in Palestine
articles.content:
Malaysia Slams Israel's Illegal Policies in Palestine

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The Malaysian permanent representative to the United Nations on Wednesday criticized Israel's "illegal policies and inhumane practices", speaking at a meeting of the UN General Assembly on Nov. 30.
					
					This will detract the efforts to realizing the aspiration of creating two sovereign States living side by side in peace, he said.
					
					"Israel needs to stop all provocative acts and improve the situation on the ground by immediately stopping the construction of illegal settlements, lifting the blockade in Gaza, addressing humanitarian needs and improving the atmosphere for negotiations, among others," he added.

articles.title: Flood Death Toll Increases in Thailand
articles.content:
Flood Death Toll Increases in Thailand

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A total of 657 people were confirmed dead and three other were missing in the floods that had inundated the upper part of Thailand for about four months as of Nov. 30, the Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Department reported on Thursday. 
					
					On Thursday, floods still prevail in 15 of 77 provinces.

articles.title: Crackdown on Demonstrators in Los Angeles, California
articles.content:
Crackdown on Demonstrators in Los Angeles, California

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The United States has persisted in crackdown upon the Occupy Wall Street demonstrators.
					
					The police authorities of Los Angeles, State of California started on Thursday operations for dispersing the demonstrators.
					
					More than 1 400 heavily-armed policemen committed violence against those staging an anti-capitalist movement outside the building of the city hall and took down their tents from Nov. 10.
					
					It is reported that the police walked off over 200 who strongly protested against its crackdown.

articles.title: New Anti-Austerity Strike Hits Greece
articles.content:
New Anti-Austerity Strike Hits Greece

					Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Greece has been paralyzed again on Thursday, as private and public sector unions held a 24-hour general strike in protest of new austerity measures.
					
					In the seventh general strike of the year which a great number of people flew into, schools and courts shut, train and ferry service ground to a halt and hospitals ran on emergency staff.
					
					Strikers strongly urged the authorities to lift such austerity measures as wage and pension cuts and mass layoffs.

articles.title: China Blames U.S. Military Moves
articles.content:
China Blames U.S. Military Moves

					Beijing, December 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Defense Ministry, in a press briefing on November 30, blamed the United States for its military moves.
					
					The U.S. has recently made preparations to deploy its troops in Australia and advanced theory of "integrated air and sea warfare".
					
					In this regard, the spokesman said it is an expression of the Cold War way of thinking to strengthen and expand military alliance.
					
					Such standpoint, aimed to guarantee its "security" by inciting confrontation and victimizing others' security, runs counter to the trend of the times towards peace, development and cooperation, he said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige ejercicios de vuelo de Unidad Aerea 378 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige ejercicios de vuelo de Unidad Aerea 378 del EPC

					Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el entrenamiento de vuelo de la Unidad 378 de las Fuerzas Aereas del EPC que ostenta el titulo del Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.

articles.title: ACNC comenta injusta posicion de Japon sobre "problema de secuestro"
articles.content:
ACNC comenta injusta posicion de Japon sobre "problema de secuestro"

					Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La seleccion coreana vencio por 1 a 0 a su rival japones en la clasificatoria de la region asiatica para la Copa Mundial 2014 de la FIFA, efectuada el 15 de noviembre en esta capital. 
					
					Al referirse a ese juego el dia 28 del mes pasado en la "comision especial para el problema de secuestro" de la camara de representantes, el diputado japones Sakamoto dijo que "si el equipo japones hubiera ganado por 2 a 0 o por 3 a 0, los futbolistas japoneses habrian sido secuestrados". 
					
					Este dicho es demasiado irresponsable para ser pronunciado por un politico.
					
					Ese partido de futbol entre Japon y la RPDC se realizo a los 22 anos despues de la clasificatoria para la Copa Mundial de Italia que tuvo lugar el ano 1989. 
					
					Debido a las relaciones congeladas entre los dos paises, han surgido unos problemas complicados ya antes del juego. 
					
					Pero, la parte coreana gestiono de manera imparcial todos los problemas manteniendo alta moralidad y ateniendose a los principios universales que rigen las relaciones internacionales. 
					
					Sin embargo, Sakamoto dijo tal chisme porque tuvo la necesidad de congraciarse con la ultraderecha conservadora.
					
					Ademas, la culpabilidad le hizo perder el sano juicio. Es que Japon impuso tremendos sufrimientos y desgracias al pueblo coreano durante el coloniaje del siglo pasado. 
					
					Ahora es el tiempo de que Japon deje de chismear sobre el "problema de secuestro" de que esta aburridisima la sociedad internacional.

articles.title: Japon no tiene derecho a hablar de los DDHH, comenta ACNC
articles.content:
Japon no tiene derecho a hablar de los DDHH, comenta ACNC

					Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En la tercera comision del 66o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, Japon se movio con entusiasmo para aprobar una "resolucion de DDHH" anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cuestionando el "problema de secuestro". 
					
					En su discurso pronunciado antes de la votacion, el embajador japones ante la ONU dijo que "no se puede descartar la posibilidad de secuestro por parte de la RPDC" y "quedan todavia algunos casos pendientes". 
					
					Es muy ridiculo que Japon, peor violador de DDHH, cuestionara cada ano el problema de DDHH de otros actuando como proponente de las "resoluciones". 
					
					En una palabra, la recien aprobada "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC es un complot politico que trazan cada ano las fuerzas hostiles a la RPDC, incluyendo a Japon. 
					
					Japon es uno de los paises que hablan tanto de los derechos humanos y del humanitarismo. 
					
					Aparentemente, Japon esta muy interesado en la solucion del problema de DDHH. 
					
					Pero, de hecho, no tiene cara para tratar ese tema porque toma actitud injusta en cuanto a los crimenes de lesa humanidad sin precedentes en la historia, cometidos contra los coreanos durante el colonialismo japones sobre Corea. 
					
					En ese periodo de cerca de medio siglo, los imperialistas japoneses asesinaron a mas de un millon de coreanos, arrestaron y secuestraron a mas de 8 millones 400 mil y convirtieron a 200 mil coreanas en las esclavas sexuales de uniformados nipones. 
					
					Sin embargo, a mas de 60 anos de su derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, intenta encubrir esos crimenes antieticos, lejos de pedir disculpas e indemnizarlos sinceramente. 
					
					Como hemos aclarado en reiteradas ocasiones, ya fue resuelto el "problema de secuestro". 
					
					Sin embargo, Japon internacionaliza ese problema para usarlo en sus siniestros fines politicos. 
					
					Japon debe prestar atencion a los problemas de casa, antes de hablar del "problema de DDHH" de otros paises.
